text: 473ml can shared with Guillaume, thanks for the share. Aroma: big pineapples aroma mixed with some juicy citrus on a biscuit backbone. App: hazy apricot with brown tint, minimal white head mécontent shy lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, yeasty a lot but juicy, light malted and bitter finish. Overall: another awesome beer. Great aroma, good taste, great mouthfeel. So so colour as often with their beer but who cares, its really good. Drinkability is really high.

10 Oz pour on site at Canton. Milky yellow pour with thin lacy white head. Aroma is intensely hoppy, dank, orange juice, grassy. Taste is bitter, juicy, orange zest. Palate is med bodied with light carbonation, creamy. Excellent despite not being one of the best trilliums.

500ml can. Pours hazy pale yellow with small white head. Nose Juicy citrusy hops with big floral notes. Intense floral notes. Taste citrusy and floral hops. Very juicy and oily. Finish juicy oily hops with floral notes. Quite spicy as well. Big fruity notes. Persistent oily and juicy hops on the finish. Pretty straight forward but quite awesome. Big fresh hoppy juice.
good hop aroma. lot of hop oomph. daves cans. orange hop oil on the finish.
Can cheers to Rich; murky yellow pour with a thin creamy off white head, aroma has pineapple and dusty pine, taste has pine, hints of tangerine, bitter dancing hood.

Pours a cloudy orange yellow like juice. Huge fruity aroma. Lots of tangerine, pineapple, and passion fruit. Moderate bitterness. Tropical and citrus fruit taste with a hint of resin. Very well done IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
O ddh trás um perfil mais floral/resinoso e amargo, seca. Médio amargor crescente e leve dulçor constante.

Bottle... Pours cloudy and golden with a razor-thin, creamy, white head that shrinks to a small, white collar. The fruity aroma is a mélange of tropical fruits, fuzzy stone fruits and melons. Medium to full-bodied with modest carbonation. The flavor features heavy, tannic, rindy bitterness. There are lightly citric and fruity undercurrents here, but big-time bitterness is in the drivers seat. Lengthy, bitter finish. I wish this was a little less bitter. Still tasty. Bottle courtesy of biggsbowler!

Can shared with Brendan and Erica at their new apartment in Astoria (thanks B!) Pours a hazy golden orange body with thick white head. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with notes of spicy herbal hop, dank pine, funky citrus and light spice. Nice stuff.

Can at home. Pours hazy pale golden with a one finger thick white head. Aroma is citrusy with oranges and grapefruit together with some pineapple and floral notes. Taste is citrus, pineapple and mango.

Can. Not a huge eldorado fan. Both scaled (4.0) and scaled up (4.2) scored lower than other Trillium ipas and iipas Ive had, though those scores are nothing to laugh at.
This has the typical bright cloudy yellow orange pour. Aroma is fantastic, a melange of citrus, pineapple. Flavor isnt quite there but is still nice. A little greener with a touch of bitterness. Probably my favorite Scaled of the 3.
Poured a hazy golden color with a white head. Aroma was of tropical hops, ligbt grain and ligbt dank. Flavor similar, a bit too bitter. Earthy and fruity. Good.

Canette de 16 oz partagée lors dune dégustation entre amis. Arôme: Odeur dagrumes et de fruits tropicaux. Apparence: La couleur est orange opaque. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dananas et de fruits de la passion avec une pointe de pamplemousse. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. (Rating #7160)

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2016 1/X/16 - 1Pt. can from a trade @ home, Fuck-Zwanze-Tasting - BB: n/a (2016-1206) Thanks to dogfish120love for the trade!
Cloudy yellow to blond beer, creamy irregular yellowish head, little stable. Aroma: very fruity, grapefruit, passion fruit, mango, lovely stuff! MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very very fruity start, pineapple, sweet, some grapefruit, lovely stuff. Aftertaste: pretty minty, bitter, resinous, pineapple, grapefruit.

Canned. Small sample. Many thanks to Roel from Frontaal. The aroma has citrus, tropical fruits, some flowers. Dunno about appearance. The taste is moderate bitter and has light toffee sweetness, citrus , tropical fruits, pineapple, biscuit malt. Medium bodied beer with average carbonation. Really full of aroma and taste. Great stuff!
Can @ MeadMe share, at Fermentoren. Hazy golden, yellowish pour with a generous head. Notes of citrus, stone fruits and some tropical fruits.

Tall boy can of two and a half months old - so I urgently needed to open it - obtained through a trade with tderoeck, thanks Tim (and thanks Ster for keeping it aside for me). One of the countless Trillium IPAs that make this brewery to what it is: the epitome of the new generation of cloudy, tropically fruity, aromatic, soft New England IPA style, along with a few other breweries in the same larger area. Dry-hopped twice, using familiar names as Citra and Columbus but also the lesser known and much more recent (2010) El Dorado. Thin, off-white, loose head quickly reduced to a tiny rim around the glass and some dots in the middle but eventually all but vanishing, over an immediately cloudy, warm peach blonde beer with ochre-ish hue. Rich, dank and lush aroma of yellow grapefruit flesh, sweet onion juice, toasted shallot, passion fruit, overripe mango, herb cheese, green banana, pine resin, light biscuit, guava, yellow curry, curcuma, lime juice, soap (the wheat, I guess), very lightly toasted white bread, zucchini, green chilli pepper, mandarin - a complex and refined combo that makes my mouth water in instants. Vividly fruity onset, a wave of tropical fruit juice with sweet and sourish components beautifully mixed to perfection, impressions of passion fruit, kumquat, lime, papaja and guava, medium carbonation (just the right amount for a modern IPA, to my taste), soft and supple, almost fluffy and slightly soapy (wheat!) mouthfeel, pleasant minerally accents here and there. A soft biscuity and lightly caramelly malt body builds in the middle, with this mixture of lush tropical fruit and minerals connecting seamlessly to a very aromatically hoppy finish, bursting with retronasal grapefruit, pine, mango, lychee and exotic pepper aromas, all with a beautiful sweet citrus (orange) lacing, and providing the soft but effective, spicy (at some point even softly raw green chilli-like), grapefruity yet elegant bitterness to dry the back of the mouth cavity without attacking it, leaving a resinous coating. Juiciness - both malty and fruity - passes through wave after wave while the resinous hop bitterness ties it all together. Alcohol goes by completely unnoticed. Another Trillium masterpiece: these guys really are the ultimate specialists in this East Coast IPA trend, delivering one beautiful example after another. This particular example goes a bit beyond the more familiar sweet tropical fruit profile of many of its congeners by adding a slightly more piney and onion-like character, which gives it that little bit of oomph and - to my personal taste - positions it a notch above many others in this particular style, however delicious those others often are. Glad I tried it - and glad I thought about opening it just in time, as this type of beers are obviously very delicate and lose much of their fragrance at an early stage. An unmistakable masterpiece in the vast - global - world of 21st-century IPA, just too bad for the lack of head...

About 2 month old Can. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of dank hops, frozen hop pallets, sweet citrus, earthy hops and slight bread. Taste of wet hops, hop pallets, bread crust, pine and sweet citrus.

Can thanks to Kreutzfeldt! Pours juicy bright orange with a small white head. Aromas of dank hops, pineapple, citrus, light earthy, sweet orange. Taste is dank, herbal, citrus, orange, grassy, light earthy, sweet lychee.

From bottle thanks to Martin&Martin! Pours a murky yellow with a small, white head. Aroma has heavy, dank hops, citrus, fairly wheaty, light honey dew. Taste is medium sweet, pretty malty, bitter, super grassy. Average carbonation and a smooth body.

October 2016 - Can share at One Canada Square. Thanks Leighton! As Trillium Double Dry Hopped Scaled, 7%. Vibrant orange, hazy, opaque, foamy off-white head. Aroma is peachy, caramel, sugary, pineapple. Nice. Body is light with soft carbonation. Taste is quite sweet, sugary, caramel, floral. Touch on the sweet side but tasty. (3.8)

pint can shared in CW. Thanks to Leighton. It pours a murky yellow color with a minimal white head. Aroma is restrained with notes of pine cones, light dank and melon. Taste is danky and grassy with notes of weed and melon, straw and apricot with a bitter astringent close. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, OK

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 Can big thanks to LKS. Enjoyed at level 42. It pours cloudy golden - orange with a medium white head. The aroma is juicy, orange, peach, apricot, marmalade and grapefruit. The taste is soft, sweet, dry, juicy, peachy, tangerine, plum, pineapple, green, grassy, danky, light alcohol and straw with a dry finish. Medium body and soft, massaging carbonation. Very juicy and crushable.  Pretty damn delicious.

Bottle split at Level 42, big thanks to Leighton, 20/10/16.
Light orange to yellow with a decent off white head.
Nose is skunky hop, orange pith, floral notes, light herb, spice, toasted bread, mandarin, grapefruit.
Taste comprises skunky hops, light mango trace, dank strokes, bitter grapefruit, orange pith, soft bread.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid Hop drool.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Can at Level 42. Big thanks to Leighton. Pours hazy yellow gold with virtually no head. Aroma is mango, pineapple tropical fruits, taste is delicate tropical fruits, good bitter hop, really easy drinking. Lovely

Bottle shared at the level 42. Canary wharf tasting 20/10/2016. Huge thanks to Leighton for this one. A translucent bright yellow straw coloured pour with a thin white head. Aroma is big juicy tangerine, orange, apricot, wheat, juicy, mixed juicy orange. Palate is medium bodied, moderate carbonation, little sticky. Flavour is composed of juicy mixed fruity orange, tangerine, little peach. Juicy. Really good. Very sessinable for double ipa.

Can shared in London - picked up in the States. Pours murky gold with a frothy, white head. Rich citrusy hops in the nose, ripe lemon, tangerine, orange. Medium sweet flavour with more juicy citrus, peach, melon, tangerine, light bitter pine needles and grapefruit pith. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Finishes with hints of lemon meringue, more tangerine, melon, grapefruit. Lovely stuff.

500mL can, sent from wilco (thanks a lot, Mike!), pours a cloudy opaque peachy orange with a medium white head. Aroma brings out lovely notes of peach, citrus and piney hops. Flavour is very fresh and fruity, with lots of dry piney hops, citrus and light tropical fruits. Very dry and piney, with little astringency on the finish. Juicy and immensely drinkable. Excellent.

This beer is near perfect. The perfect balance of hopps and citrus without any maltiness. Taste is hoppy and grapefruioty. Pours a cloudy light orange with a thin white head. Jesus is this awesome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Muito aromática, cítrico e gramíneo. Linda cor, do amarelo pro laranja, bem turva, com espuma branca de boa duração. Corpo sedoso. Final seco. Alta drinkability.

16 oz can from ebone1988 just because, I suppose. The pour is a turbid orange juice with a nice thin white head that falls down to a film, leaving no lace. The aroma is juicy and delicious. There is a hint of dry leafy hops on the back end, but its balanced and juicy. I love it. The flavor is a little more reserved. There is a bigger bitterness to it and a the juice is still there, but its lighter. Balanced and nice. The mouth feel is a little watery and slick with a bright carbonation and a lingeringly juicy and leafy bitterness. Really good offering from Trillium
Can shared at Fuck-Zwanze-daytasting. Hoppy, juicy, pineapples, lemon. Awesome!

Hazy golden-orange body, medium sized white head, soapy lacing. Dank, dirty citrus with some herbal notes from the El Dorado and Columbus. Medium bodied, softer carbonation, lively bitterness, semi-dry throughout, satisfying finish.
(can) cloudy yellow colour with a medium tall white head; aroma of grapefruit, tropical fruit, then some stewed fruit; balanced flavour, not too dry, with a long, light bitter finish
Pours a hazy murky pale straw yellow with a white lacing. The aroma is spicey with some musty notes, papaya, pineapple, orange and grapefruit. Finishes with a hint of alcohol. Bone dry.
Pour is incredibly hazy, light orange colour. Aroma has loads of pineapple, mango, citrus, dank. Pure hop juice. Creamy mouthfeel with a bitter finish. Out of this world.

Aroma is juicy as fuck, tropical fruit, citrus, dank, very very dank, wonderful, pine. Appearance is orange juice, hazy as fuck, off white head. Taste is juicy juicy, tropical fruit, citrus, then hardcore dankness, pine, resin, so very good. Mouthfeel is light body, light carbonation, slightly crisp, wonderful dank citrus aftertaste. Overall, theyve done it again. Yowza.
Growler straight from the source. Murky, milky orange/yellow pour with a white head. Apricot and nectarine bouquet. Taste follows suit with a sturdy caramel malt presence. Good body and mouthfeel.

Really hazy peach juice color with off-white head. Aroma is really juicy with lots of mango and pineapple. Taste starts with resiny hops and mango juicy. On the finish, a good amount of bitterness kicks in and lingers for a long time on the aftertaste with lots of grapefruit pith. Medium body and carbonation. Another great IPA from Trillium.

Canette 473ml, gracieuseté de msjpearson, Thanks Mike! Couleur jaune-orangée pâle opaque, mousse blanche fuyante. Arôme dorange, pamplemousse, zeste de citron, houblon résineux. Goût de houblon résineux, amertume modérée, malt pâle, agrumes, léger sucré, léger côté herbacé en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne, corps dense, texture ample.

16oz can thanks to Steve. Pours out a hazy pale straw color topped with a small head. Nose is nice floral citrus some hop juice and cereal. Taste is more of the nice spice hops citrus and a mellow end.

16oz. Bomber. Poured a nice hazy yellow. Thick head. Aroma of peach, lemon rind, green peppercorn. Taste is a citrus sour explosion. Lots of stone fruit on the palate. Nice bitter finish. A delight to drink.
Bottle. Color hazy yellow with medium white head. Aroma, grass, floral, citrus, pine, orange, pineaple. Taste citrus, orange, peach, pine.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orangish color. Aroma and taste are citrus juice and tropical fruits.

660 ml bottle courtesy of skullgeorge. Thanks George! Hazy yellow color with white head. Hoppy aroma, grassy, dank, weedy, floral, citrusy fruity, orange, pineaple, some malty notes. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation

Tasted on 6/27/16 from a capped 750mL bottle, about a month old, big thanks to Alex for sharing. Pours like cloudy bright orange juice, almost looks like Sunny D, with a thick, uneven white head that slowly recedes to average lace, leaving some sticky lacing along the inside of the glass. The nose is super complex with a bunch of dank tropical fruit, pineapple, fresh orange and lemon zest, peach blossom, apricot, with very light hints of coconut and light bread. The flavor is really focused on the citrus and pitted fruit notes, with the pineapple, floral notes, light dankness, and hint of malt and bitterness on the back. The body is medium with average carbonation and a long, lightly bitter pitted fruit, pineapple, and citrus peel finish. World class.

Hazy. Pineapple juice bomb.

It seriously just tastes like Citra and El Dorado tea. 

A - Citra hops. Pineapple. Passionfruit.
Ap - hazy, cloudy, deep yellow. 
T - juicy, sweet. Hoppy, but not overpoweringly bitter. Relatively quick finish. Doesnt linger. Really, really nice!
P - quick finish, but the hop flavors do linger for a bit. Hops mostly mask the booze, but you do get some heat.
22 ounce bottle from Timfoolery, creamy, very slightly bitter, pale yellow.

Bottle, big thanks to Harrison. Pours out that murky, cloudy golden to juice color with a small to medium white head. Aroma is of juicy citrus fruit, tropical mango, lime, sweet guava, pineapple, some light grainy notes, intense juiciness. Taste is complex, lots of juicy tropical fruit, fresh lime, sweet guava, mango, light pineapple, some toast. Juicy and drying bitterness at the same time. This is really solid.

Bottle share. Pours a turbid pale yellow color with a small fizzy white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, dank, pungent, earthy. Flavor had a mix of pungent over ripe fruit - pineapple, grapefruit, orange, mango, earthy, dank. Medium to full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, bitter bite to finish.
750ml. Aroma is grapefruit and pine, smells amazing. Taste doesnt quite live up to the smell. Bitter and watery.

32oz growler from the brewery pours a very hazy, yellow with plenty of frothy, white head. Nose has lemon, tangerine, white grape, a little yeast, straw. Flavor is heavy on the lemon, a little watermelon rind, mild candy, mild straw. Finishes a bit wet. Good, but a little sweet.
Sample at Sloop thanks to Jon. Pours a hazy yellow , white head. Aroma is huge joooose, citrus, Dank, gooey fruit, papaya, mango. Flavor is similar, some grass, smooth amped up juice. Lovely

Bottle at the Hoppy Pub. 2 weeks old. Pours yellow hazy with a White head. Amazing aromas of citrus, grass, earthy, pineaple. Taste is fruits, bitter, grassy and so fresh. Bitter after taste and medium body. Amazing beer
Bottle thanks to Seth. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit, mango and melon. Thick mouth, pineapple, juicy hop, must, light dry finish, very good.
On tap at row 34. Pours a cloudy peach color with a white head. Aromas of peaches, light grapefruit, light earthiness. Taste is medium bitterness that is fairly sharp but not overbearing.

Bottle. Pours an opaquely hazed apricot with a large white head. Big citrus on the nose, subtle undertones of kumquat and grapefruit. Medium-bodied, soft musk, light melon, a touch of mango sweetness. Slow juicy finish with a good amount of lingering melon drenched grapefruit pith.

Pours hazy mango with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of apricot, citrus, grapefruit, tangerine, slight lactose notes. Taste is very citrusy and fruity with a robust backbone. Mouthfeel is quite creamy and juicy with medium carbonation and body.

Keg at Omnipollos Hatt, Stockholm.  Cloudy straw colour, creamy. Juicy tangerine aroma. Mid sweet with medium body and well rounded mouthfeel. Tangerine and mango dominates. Fruity with neutral malt base. Mid bitter finish with notes of saccharine. Elegant, cool post modern IPA.

Pours milky citrus with low white head
Aromas intense of citrusy fruits, hints of lactose, pineapple, caramel
Taste has nice hoppy citrusy notes, lemongrass, pineapple, grapefruit, hints of caramel
Low to medium carbonation, medium bodied, low bitterness, quite dry. Very nice!

Bottle shared at tasting, thanks! Cloudy blond with a small white head. Aroma of garlic, intense fruity hops, tropical, citrus and onion. Flavour is light sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle sampled at a tasting.
Lovely citrus aroma. Thin white head. Cloudy blond pour. Lovely bitterness. Very nice.

March 11, 2016. Bottle, courtesy of James, thanks! 
Cloudy orange with a large creamy head. Aroma is intense fruity and herbal with orange, peach, pineapple, grass, onion, chives, toasted crackers and slight earthy notes. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium soft bitterness. Finish is sweet toasted malt, hints of pineapple, bitter orange zest, some earthy and herbal chive notes. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Very nice!

750 mL bottle. Pale orange body. Aroma is bright orange, wheat grain, lightly spicy hop aroma. Taste is bright orange. Very citrusy. I get a bright lemon component as well. Sweet pale malt. Wheaty grain. Medium body. Pretty sweet. Delicious.
another amazing IPA from trillium. Tons of hops, aroma and citrus flavors without the bitterness. No bitterness on the finish, all tropical pineappa joose.
Bottle - pours gold white head - nose/taste of pineapple, citrus, lime, grapefruit and toasted cracker malt - medium body.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy golden with medium white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of garlic, pine, tropical fruits, soap, oranges. Taste is of garlic, pine, bitterness, citrus, oranges, very slight alcohol. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Medium carbonation. Overall: Very nice, juicy.

Thanks to czar for sharing this gem! Pours a moderately hazy golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of juicy fruits, onion and light alcohol. Taste is really fruity with some nice tropical fruits, oranges and light pine. Just so juicy with its moderate body and medium-high carbonation. Awesome IPA! In line with their best stuff (Vicinity, DDH FPPA).

pours cloudy pale golden with a small white cap offering some retention and lacing. danky melons and citrus, onions and garlic-plenty, peppery pineapples, mangoes, doughy maltiness, salt, clean yeast action. moderate carbonation, light to medium body - oily; smooth and balanced melon-spicy-citrusy finish. excellent ipa - tropical-garlic juice!

Bottle (750 ml) at tasting. Shared by czar, thank! Cloudy orangey-golden with a medium bubbly white head, medium retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is a burst of onions and tropical fruits, oranges / creamsickle, mild earthiness and herbal notes. Taste is super oniony with oranges, tropical fruits, mild earthy notes, herbal notes, decent malt backbone and juicy notes. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Juicy mouthfeel. Oniony and oranges. Another excellent dank IPA from Trillium. The onion / orange mix is weird but surprisingly interesting. Great!

Au fût avec un fish & chips au Row 34. Une belle robe jaune trouble avec une mousse blanche. Un nez frais avec des agrumes, des ananas, de la mangue. Une bouche agréable, fruitée, floral avec une finale sur les agrumes.
Bottle. Id assume golden pour with white head. Herbal, grassy and earthy hop aromas. Flavors are herbal and grassy forward, some citrus and earthy hop tones as well.
Cloudy yellow. Nose of danker, earthier hops with grapefruit pith. Taste is light lime, dank, slightly garlicy hops, with some citrus pith. Great, juicy stuff.

Bottle. The pour is a hazy dark yellow. The aroma is sweet hop bomb, very nice. The taste is also full of hops, very nice and a mouthful. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Like everything else from their "Double Dry Hopped" series, this takes an already excellent Trillium beer and amplifies the hop presence through the roof. This DDH version is sticky, cloudy, and resiny from how much hop oil is floating around, and that is a very good thing. Theres a lot of great, clean hop flavor, although the extra El Dorado hops did kind of make it a little cloying. Overall, this is one in a long line of try exceptional Trillium beers. Definitely seek it out if you can!

Really nice hazy pale pour with white head. Aroma is intense grapefruit, lime, mango, and earthy. Taste is sharply bitter and somewhat resiny. I dont care for how earthy el dorado hops are but otherwise cool beer.

Bottle purchased at the brewery. Bottle date of 19 January 2016. Aroma is off the chain. Loaded with tons of fruit, pineapple, mango, passion fruit and just a note of pine. Damn, I smell this as it is poured. How many pounds of hops did they use?? 
The flavor has just a touch of yeast to go with this hop profile. Fresh juicy fruits with a mild touch of pine hops with a nice mild malt balance. Not overly sweet and not so bitter it kills your taste buds. The mouthfeel has a nice soft / airy/ delicate aspect found in some other New England IPAs. Balance is really great. There is a reason there is a buzz at this brewery. 
I am making more of a effort to visit this place more often.
750ml bottle pours a hazy dirty yellow color with a bit of frothy head. Some pineapple flavor and lots of hop bitterness. Not much other tropical fruit notes.

En fût, Row 34. Robe voilée et jaune. Mousse collante. Superbe nez dananas avec divers agrumes, de la terre, des herbes, du sorbet à la mangue. Goût fruité, acidulé, jlherbacé, floral, complexe, très fort. En bouche, corps parfait ou presque, bonnes bulles, corps juteux. Finale franche, amère, pleine de mangues piquantes. Délicieuse.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2017 Growler filled 1/29/16 and drunk 1/30/16.Massively sweet, juicy, tropical, lush aromatics burst forth upon opening the growler. Wow. Can smell this stuff from a couple feet away. Intensifies as its being poured, with a heavily hazy orange-golden body and a large white head that fades slowly to cover.Pineapple, guava, mango, lime, lemon, grapefruit. Pretty much all manner of citrus and tropical fruit is covered here. No alcohol and only sparse honey and biscuit-like malts behind it.Flavor is a bit more of a mixed-bag for me. It starts out delightfully tropical, bursting with citrus and light honey, as well. Juicy and lush, it slowly picks up that heavy tanginess that I associate with El Dorado. It turns rather sharp and perfumey on the finish and is really the only thing holding this thing back from being an absolute showstopper. The malts are well-attenuated, with a soft, creamy-to-oily texture and tight carbonation. Probably had they used a different hop, Id appreciate it more, but as is, I just dont care much for El Dorados punchy/tangy/sharpness. 9/4/7/4/14

Canned 2/7/17, drunk 2/20/17.
This was damned-near perfect for a NE IPA and one of the best Trilliums Ive had in a long while. Juicy, crisp and perfectly bitter (not very) with none of the ester, sweat, twang or booze that sometimes plagues their beers. Soft and inviting mouthfeel with perfect carbonation and delicate honey and cracker notes. Juicy lime, mango and pineapple with hints of cherry, spicy, green, dank and complex hop notes. Wow! Overall score is for this version.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden orange, medium creamy off-white head, dissipates fairly quickly but laces really well. Aroma is pine and pineapple, perfume and dank wet leaves. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, juicy and resinous. Medium body, soft creamy mouthfeel. Not the most amazing hop combination, but solid in every way.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2016 Lots of very fresh hops. Almost tastes unripe. Aroma of sharp tangerine and some green onion. Pours hazy orange with good head and lacing. Bitter finish. Some peel and pine. Very nice. Bottle drank in my hotel room in Harar.

Very excited over this one. Bottled 1-19-16 and consumed 2-2-16 so exactly two weeks old. Pours (well, we all seen dem Instagram pics of these NE ipas) looks like juice. Like oranges, peaches, and bananas put onto a juice extractor and this is what you get. Along with a thin white head. Smell is fruity, really fruity, gotta love that ddh. Theres peaches, pineapples, mangos, some spice and herbs, some cilantro? wheat and some oj. For the most part its fruity. The taste is really complex. It starts fruity and tropical, but quickly gets piney with plenty of bitterness to follow suit. Followed by the spices and herbs, with a dry finish. Has plenty of carbonation, in the high side for an ipa, rather light, but its able to keep its creaminess. Overall pretty good, and very complex. I got alot of flavors from this ipa. Its still piney and bitter though. I didnt see this as whole different pedigree (not this one for the moment. Nonetheless its solid. Would bang again if I can get my hands on it again.

Poured from a bottle into a tulip: Pours hazy straw / orange with a nice white head and good retention. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, pineapple, and cracker malts. Taste is very citrus forward, a little bready, nice bitter finish. Really nice IPA.

Un grand merci à Yannick pour cette bouteille! Cheers mon vieux! Le liquide a un forte densité laiteuse et crémeuse dans mon verre. On dirait vraiment quune touche lactée fut ajoutée au liquide pour lui donner une allure aussi soyeuse et douce, tandis quune mousse uniforme et alléchante se forme au dessus du liquide. Un nez à la Trillium! Le Citra est parfaitement balancé et offre un profil aromatique très houblonné, sans verser dans le pipi de chat ou dans lécorce dagrume trop puissante. Des notes terreuses et humides se joignent au bouquet fruité et ajoutent ainsi une couche supplémentaire de complexité. En bouche, les arômes sexpriment librement dans la même veine. Le fruit est frais et riche, le liquide juteux tout en étant bien malté mais jamais lourd ni sucré. Une harmonie parfaite des saveurs et des textures. Encore une bière absolument délicieuse de cette brasserie qui collectionne les succès!

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma strong of fruity and citrusy hops, some pale malts, and light dough. Flavor the same with a great hoppiness and light malts to balance them out. Average texture. A very solid beer.

On tap at Armsby Abbey. I believe this batch was brewed at Trilliums second location in Canton (no, not the Chinese Canton). Hazy, unfiltered pale orange colored brew with a juicy citrus aroma, which is echoed in the fruity flavor. This is a well-crafted and balanced brew. A little bit of pine and lime adding a lot of complexity and making this quite an interesting ale. Have yet to see this breweries products penetrating as far as Western Mass, but with product this good and a recent expansion, theres hope.
Opaque, cloudy tan pour, small white head. Aroma is sweet of cream, caramel and citrus. Flavor is sweet of grass and citrus.

Pours Trillium hazy into a tulip. Bright white head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Yeast, pineapple and passion fruit aromas. Medium bodied with sweet yeast and caramel upfront turning to tropical fruit before the lasting dry pith finish.
